file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 49-12-02-04 - APU ELASTOMERIC MOUNTS - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL APU ELASTOMERIC MOUNTS - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the APU elastomeric mounts of the center links. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY APU ELASTOMERIC MOUNTS - REMOV- ALL 49-12-02-000-801-A AL APU ELASTOMERIC MOUNTS - INSTAL- ALL 49-12-02-400-801-A LATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 49-12-02 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 49-12-02-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. APU ELASTOMERIC MOUNTS - REMOVAL A. General (1) The APU elastomeric mounts supports the APU, and eliminate the vibration to the aircraft fuselage. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 49-00-00/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES AMM TASK 49-11-00-000-801-A/400 APU COWLING - REMOVAL AMM TASK 49-15-00-000-801-A/400 APU COWLING - REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 313 313 APU D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY GSE 138 APU Removal/Installation Arm To lift the APU E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Workstand To get access to the work area 1 available Commercially Hoist To lift the APU 1 available F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 2 Do the task APU EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 49-12-02 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A WARNING: BEFORE YOU DO THE TASK OBEY THE SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN ( AMM MPP 49-00-00/200) TO PREVENT INJURY TO THE PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO THE MATERIAL. (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open these circuit breakers and attach DO-NOT-CLOSE tags to them: – APU FUEL SOV. (2) On the left power control and distribution box, open the APU GEN START circuit breaker and attach DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to it. (3) Remove the APU cowling ( AMM TASK 49-11-00-000-801-A/400 or AMM TASK 49-15-00-000-801-A/400, as applicable). (4) Install the APU Removal/Installation Arm, and attach it to the hoist. (5) Adjust the height of the hoist correctly to remove the APU weight. J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove screw (4), washers (3), nut (1), and lock plate (5). (2) Remove screw (15), washers (16), nut (18), and lock plate (17). (3) Remove cotter pin (7), nut (8), washers (6), bonding wires (2), washer (19), and bolt (14). (4) Remove the bushing (13), elastomeric mounts (9) and spacers (11). (5) Discard the old elastomeric mounts, and cotter pin. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 49-12-02 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL APU Elastomeric Mounts - Removal/Installation Figure 401 B A ZONE 313 DET. A 2. BONDING WIRE 3. WASHER 3. WASHER 1. NUT 18. NUT 16. WASHER 4. SCREW 17. LOCK PLATE 19.WASHER 5. LOCK PLATE 16. WASHER 7. COTTER PIN 1 8. NUT 15. SCREW 6. WASHER 14. BOLT 9. ELASTOMERIC MOUNT 11. SPACERS 13. BUSHING 10. CENTER LINK 9. ELASTOMERIC MOUNT DET. B 12. CENTER LINK 1 TORQUE: 6.7 TO 9.0 N.m (60 TO 80 lb.in) (Plus running torque) 145AMM490017.MCE A EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 49-12-02 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 49-12-02-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. APU ELASTOMERIC MOUNTS - INSTALLATION A. General (1) Obey the instructions below to install the APU elastomeric mounts. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 49-11-00-400-801-A/400 APU COWLING - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 49-15-00-400-801-A/400 APU COWLING - INSTALLATION IPC 49-12-00 APU MOUNTING SYSTEM C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 313 313 APU D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY GSE 138 APU Removal/Installation Arm To lift the APU Commercially Torque Wrench To torque the attaching screws available E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Workstand To get access to the work area 1 available Commercially Hoist To lift the APU 1 available F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) Cotter pin IPC 49-12-00 1 Elastomeric Mounts IPC 49-12-00 4 EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 49-12-02 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 2 Do the task APU I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Install the new elastomeric mounts (9) and spacers (11) to the rod. (2) Return the bushing (13) to its correct position. (3) Install the bolt (14), washer (19), bonding wires (2), washers (6), and nut (8). (4) Torque the nut (8). (Refer to Figure 401 for torque value). (5) Install the new cotter pin (7), bolt lock plate (17) with screw (15), washers (16), and nut (18). (6) Install the lock plate (5) with screw (4), washers (3), and nut (1). (7) Tight nuts and screws. J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Remove the hoist and the APU Removal/Installation Arm from APU. (2) Install the APU cowling ( AMM TASK 49-11-00-400-801-A/400 or AMM TASK 49-15-00-400-801-A/400, as applicable). (3) Remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tags and close these circuit breakers. – APU FUEL SOV. (4) On the left power control and distribution box, remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag and close the APU GEN START circuit breaker.
